data.question: What are the two types of air-stable sulfur-ligated dysprosium complexes discussed?
What is the coordination environment of the Dy(III) ion in the complexes?
What geometry does the [DyL4]− unit in complex 1·4CH3OH have?
What is the main difference in geometry between complex 1 and complex 2?
data.answer: Complex 1 has a triangular dodecahedron geometry, while complex 2 has a biaugmented trigonal prism geometry.

data.question: What type of magnetic relaxation process is observed for complex 2 at zero dc field?
Under what condition do both complexes display the typical Raman process?
What is the predicted energy barrier for magnetic relaxation in complex 1 according to ab initio calculations?
Is the relaxation time for the quantum tunneling process in complex 2 close to the experimental value?
Does the presence of sulfur atoms in the equatorial plane reduce the magnetic anisotropy in Dy–SMMs?
data.answer: No, sulfur atoms in the equatorial plane are used to weaken the spherical ligand field and not directly reduce magnetic anisotropy.

data.question: Can the subtle change from triangular dodecahedron to biaugmented trigonal prism geometry affect single-molecular magnetism?
Is the main magnetic axis of the ground Kramers doublet for Dy in complex 1 parallel to the shortest coordination bond?
Does complex 1 exhibit a faster relaxation without a visible peak under zero dc field?
Are the complexes [HN(Et)3][Dy2NaL8] (1) and [DyNaL4(MeOH)x(H2O)2−x]n (2) based on the same ligand?
Does the Orbach process compete with the Raman process in the magnetic relaxation of the complexes?
Is the predicted energy barrier for magnetic relaxation higher in complex 2 than in complex 1?
data.answer: Yes, it is 303 cm−1 for complex 2 and 287 cm−1 for complex 1.

data.question: What is the role of hard donor atoms in the construction of air-stable superior S-ligated Dy–SMMs?
data.answer: Hard donor atoms are chosen along the axial direction to enhance the axial magnetic anisotropy.

data.question: What is the effect of applying a dc field on the quantum tunneling process observed in complex 2?
data.answer: Applying a dc field efficiently suppresses the quantum tunneling process.

data.question: What is the significance of controlling the local symmetry in the construction of Dy–SMMs?
data.answer: Controlling the local symmetry is important to suppress the zero-field quantum tunneling.

data.question: What is the main magnetic axis orientation in the ground state doublets for the complexes according to ab initio calculations?
data.answer: The main magnetic axis of ground states for both complexes is nearly parallel to the shortest coordination bond.

data.question: What is the main strategy for constructing air-stable sulfur-ligated Dy–SMMs with high coordination numbers?
data.answer: The strategy involves keeping soft donor sulfur atoms in the equatorial plane, choosing hard donor atoms along the axial direction, and controlling the local symmetry.
